intro: Pera bicolor, commonly known as the two-colored pera, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It is characterized by its striking bi-colored flowers, which typically feature a combination of white and purple hues. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and branched. Pera bicolor is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
